metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2831 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.2 do not ensure that the user approves the fullscreen and pointerlock settings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (UI outage), or conduct clickjacking or spoofing attacks, via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
